0: Pittsburgh is commonly known as "The Steel City" due to its historic steel industry and "The City of Bridges" because it has 446 bridges.
1: After the decline of the steel industry, Pittsburgh shifted its economic focus to healthcare, education, and technology.
2: The annual Picklesburgh festival in Pittsburgh celebrates pickles and has been recognized as the best specialty food festival in America.
3: Pittsburgh’s post-World War II clean air and civic revitalization project was called the "Renaissance."
4: When a holiday falls on or before a resident’s collection day, trash and recycling pick-up will be delayed by one day.
5: There are 143 active bridges in Pittsburgh.
6: The Great Fire of Pittsburgh in 1845 caused significant damage to the city, destroying 24 blocks of businesses, homes, and churches.
7: Carnegie Mellon University was originally called Carnegie Technical Schools before it was renamed in 1912.
8: Acrisure Stadium is known for its incredible skyline views and has hosted two outdoor NHL hockey games, the 2011 NHL Winter Classic and the 2017 NHL Stadium Series.
9: Children's Museum of Pittsburgh; Carnegie Science Center; Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens; Pittsburgh Zoo & Aquarium; Kennywood amusement park.
10: The amusement tax rate in Pittsburgh for admission to entertainment venues is 5%; The amusement tax rate in Pittsburgh for admission to entertainment venues is 0.04762.
11: Individuals earning less than $12,000 annually within Pittsburgh; active-duty military personnel; and honorably discharged veterans with a 100% service-connected disability are exempt from paying the Local Services Tax (LST).
12: The total appropriated general fund budget for the City of Pittsburgh in 2024 is $684,677,414.
13: The City of Pittsburgh received $335,070,222 from the Coronavirus State and Local Fiscal Recovery Fund (CSLFRF) under the American Rescue Plan.
15: More than 400 startups linked to Carnegie Mellon University have raised over $7 billion in follow-on funding.
16: The Toto concert featuring Christopher Cross and Men at Work is taking place on July 24, 2025, at 6:45 PM at The Pavilion at Star Lake in Burgettstown, PA.
17: The artists scheduled to perform at Carnegie Music Hall of Oakland in Pittsburgh in 2025 include The Magnetic Fields; Alex Edelman; Noah Reid; Ryan Adams.
18: The Over The Edge event on March 29, 2025, allows participants to rappel 21 stories from 625 Liberty Avenue in downtown Pittsburgh to support Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Pittsburgh.
19: The Broadway musical Some Like It Hot will be performed in Pittsburgh from April 15 to April 20, 2025.
20: The Rhythm of the Dance show on March 23, 2025, at The Palace Theatre features a large cast of Irish step-dancers, live musicians, and new choreography.
21: The Pittsburgh Riverhounds vs. Birmingham Legion soccer match on March 29, 2025, at Highmark Stadium celebrates Pittsburgh Night.
22: The theme for Carnegie Mellon University’s Spring Carnival Booth Build in 2025 is "Hollywood."
23: The CMU Alumni Awards categories include Founders Medal for Outstanding Service and Exceptional Achievement; Alumni Achievement Award; Alumni Service Award; Recent Alumni Achievement Award; Recent Alumni Service Award.
24: Traditional events include Buggy races; Mobot competition; Midway activities; and Booth displays.
25: The joint exhibition is called "Holding Still, Holding On."
26: "Here to Stay: Celebrating 40 Years at the Architecture Archives" is a University Libraries exhibition that celebrates the 40th anniversary of the Architecture Archives at Carnegie Mellon University.
27: "Like, Totally Transformative: CMU in the 1980s" is a University Libraries exhibit that offers a snapshot of life on Carnegie Mellon’s campus more than four decades ago.
28: The Pittsburgh Penguins lost to the Vegas Golden Knights 4-0 on March 7, 2025.
29: The Pittsburgh Penguins will play the New Jersey Devils on March 15, 2025, at 3:00 PM EDT, and the game will be broadcast on ABC and ESPN+.
30: Cameron Heyward has been with the Pittsburgh Steelers the longest, with 14 years of experience in the NFL.
31: The wide receivers currently on the Pittsburgh Steelers' active roster are Calvin Austin III; Brandon Johnson; DK Metcalf; George Pickens; Roman Wilson; Lance McCutcheon.
32: The Pittsburgh Steelers acquired wide receiver DK Metcalf from the Seattle Seahawks in exchange for their second-round pick (52nd overall) and seventh-round pick (223rd overall) in the 2025 NFL Draft. The Steelers also received Seattle’s sixth-round pick (185th overall) in the 2025 NFL Draft.
33: DK Metcalf has three 1,000-yard receiving seasons in his NFL career.
34: The Pittsburgh Pirates lost to the Minnesota Twins 15-3 on March 16, 2025.
35: The Pittsburgh Pirates' 2025 home opener is on April 4, 2025, at 4:12 PM against the New York Yankees.
36: Children at the Great American Banana Split Celebration can enjoy face painting, balloon animals, interactive games, and a rock climbing wall.
37: The Great American Banana Split Celebration offers classic festival foods like funnel cakes and corn dogs, fresh eats from local food trucks, lemonade, and craft beer.
38: The 2025 Little Italy Days festival in Bloomfield will take place from Thursday, August 14, to Sunday, August 17.
39: The VIP Experience at Little Italy Days includes a festival T-shirt, a slice of pizza from Caliente Pizza, a bottle of water, VIP restroom access, and seating in the VIP tent near the main stage.
40: The Pittsburgh Restaurant Week Winter 2025 will take place from Monday, January 13, to Sunday, January 19, with an Early Access Weekend from Friday, January 10, to Sunday, January 12.
41: The annual theme for Pittsburgh Restaurant Week Winter 2025 is 'New Dishes for the New Year.'
42: The Pittsburgh Taco Festival 2024 will take place on Saturday, September 14, 2024, from 12:30 PM to 7:00 PM, with early entry at 11:30 AM for Gold Ticket holders.
43: The mission of the Pittsburgh Taco Festival is to celebrate tacos while supporting and raising funds for the city’s Latin-American community, particularly through partnerships with Pittsburgh Hispanic Development Corporation (PHDC) and Casa San Jose.
44: Picklesburgh 2025 will take place from July 11-13, 2025, in Downtown Pittsburgh, with exact location details to be announced soon.
45: Picklesburgh 2025 was named the Readers’ Choice Best Specialty Food Festival by USA Today 10Best, marking its fourth win in this category.
46: The Pittsburgh Soul Food Festival will take place during Labor Day weekend, from August 30 to September 1, 2024, in Pittsburgh.
47: Pittsburgh hosts several food festivals, including Pittsburgh Restaurant Week (Winter & Summer); Picklesburgh; Soul Food Festival; Taco Festival; Apple, Maple, and Whiskey Festivals; and various neighborhood soup crawls and cookie tours.
48: The ancient Egyptian exhibition at Carnegie Museum running through Summer 2025 is called 'The Stories We Keep.'
49: The traveling exhibition 'Mental Health: Mind Matters' at the Science Center focuses on mental health awareness and runs through August 17, 2025.
50: The exhibit 'Louise Silk: A Patchwork Life' at the Heinz History Center showcases the life and quilts of Pittsburgh artist Louise Silk.
51: The Special Collections Gallery at the Heinz History Center features original set pieces and exclusive artifacts from Mister Rogers' Neighborhood.
52: The exhibition is called 'Harper's Pictorial History of the Civil War (Annotated)' by Kara Walker.
53: The Gilded, Not Golden tour at The Frick Pittsburgh focuses on the year 1892, highlighting a pivotal time for Pittsburgh and the Frick family.
54: The Car and Carriage Museum at The Frick Pittsburgh features horse-drawn carriages and some of the first automobiles that impacted Pittsburgh’s history.
55: The Andy Warhol Museum in North Shore, Pittsburgh, houses over 4,000 of Warhol's artworks, including paintings, drawings, prints, sculptures, installations, photographs, and films.
56: Some museums in Pittsburgh that focus on history and culture include the Heinz History Center, which covers the history of Western Pennsylvania and includes the Western Pennsylvania Sports Museum; the Fort Pitt Museum, which explores Fort Pitt’s role in the French & Indian War, American Revolution, and the Whiskey Rebellion; the August Wilson Center for African American Culture, which highlights African American history and culture in Pittsburgh and worldwide; The Frick Pittsburgh, which features the restored Frick mansion (Clayton), the Frick Art Museum, the Car and Carriage Museum, and gardens; and the Nationality Rooms at the University of Pittsburgh, which showcase different cultures that influenced Pittsburgh’s growth through themed classrooms.
57: Lang Lang will perform with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra on Wednesday, March 19, 2025, at Heinz Hall.
58: The upcoming concert 'Music of Star Wars' by the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra will feature unforgettable themes from all the epic films, from A New Hope to The Rise of Skywalker.
59: The Pittsburgh Opera will perform Madama Butterfly at the Benedum Center on Saturday, March 22, 2025, at 8:00 PM and Tuesday, March 25, 2025, at 7:00 PM.
60: Annie will be performed at the Benedum Center in Pittsburgh on Friday, March 14, 2025, and Saturday, March 15, 2025.
61: Over the past 10 years, more than 400 startups linked to CMU have raised more than $7 billion in follow-on funding.
62: Pittsburgh will host the NFL Draft in 2026 in partnership with the Pittsburgh Steelers.
63: Some major annual events in Pittsburgh include the Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix, Kennywood Holiday Lights, Pittsburgh Humanities Festival, Little Italy Days, Millvale Music Festival, 3 Rivers Comicon, America's Mile, Tekko, Rock, Reggae & Relief, Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest, Pittsburgh International Auto Show, and Pittsburgh Home & Garden Show.
64: Acrisure Stadium is known for its incredible skyline views and has hosted two outdoor NHL hockey games.
65: The phone number for the City of Pittsburgh's 311 Response Center is 412-255-2621.
66: The Carnegie Institute of Technology merged with the Mellon Institute in 1967.
67: In the 1750s, Pittsburgh became a battleground when France and Great Britain fought for control of the region.
68: The event is called Code & Crematory 2025.
69: The David & Susan Coulter Welcome Center is located in the Tepper Quadrangle at Carnegie Mellon University.
70: Spring Carnival Weekend at Carnegie Mellon University is from April 3-5, 2025.
